content.full_text: Check of Abraham Lincoln to Bailhache & Baker, 28 September 18571 Springfield Marine & Fire Insurance Company, Pay toBailhache & Bakeror Bearer Ten/100Dollars, IN CURRENT BANK NOTES. $10–002 Richards & Smith,printers.
paragraphs: Check of Abraham Lincoln to Bailhache & Baker, 28 September 18571
citations: Franklin William Scott,Newspapers and Periodicals of Illinois, 1814-1879, vol. 6 ofCollections of the Illinois State Historical Library(Springfield: Illinois State Historical Library, 1910), 321, 324; Harry E. Pratt,The Personal Finances of Abraham Lincoln(Springfield, IL: Abraham Lincoln Association, 1943), 166.

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln filled in the blanks of this partially printed check and signed it.

2Lincoln’s payment of $10 to the publishing firm of Bailhache & Baker was for subscription
                  to theIllinois State Journal. The funds were withdrawn from his account at the Springfield Marine & Fire Insurance
                  Company on September 30, 1857.Franklin William Scott,Newspapers and Periodicals of Illinois, 1814-1879, vol. 6 ofCollections of the Illinois State Historical Library(Springfield: Illinois State Historical Library, 1910), 321, 324; Harry E. Pratt,The Personal Finances of Abraham Lincoln(Springfield, IL: Abraham Lincoln Association, 1943), 166.

structured_content.text: Check of Abraham Lincoln to Bailhache & Baker, 28 September 18571
